parts.text: {"word":"subside","priority":"★★☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"(騒ぎ、興奮、痛みなどが)静まる、鎮まる、和らぐ","english_definition":"to become less intense, violent, or severe; to abate.","examples":[{"sentence":"The floodwaters began to subside.","translation":"洪水は引き始めた。"},{"sentence":"The pain in my leg gradually subsided.","translation":"足の痛みは徐々に和らいだ。"},{"sentence":"The storm eventually subsided.","translation":"嵐は最終的に静まった。"},{"sentence":"After the argument, his anger slowly subsided.","translation":"口論の後、彼の怒りはゆっくりと静まった。"}],"collocations":["subside gradually (徐々に静まる)","subside slowly (ゆっくりと静まる)","subside completely (完全に静まる)","anger subsides (怒りが静まる)","floodwaters subside (洪水が引く)","pain subsides (痛みが和らぐ)","storm subsides (嵐が静まる)"],"synonyms":["abate","diminish","lessen","ease","alleviate","mitigate","calm down","settle down","wane"],"antonyms":["intensify","increase","escalate","worsen"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"(地面、建物などが)沈下する、地盤沈下する","english_definition":""(of land or a building) to sink to a lower level.","examples":[{"sentence":"The house is subsiding because of the unstable ground.","translation":"家は不安定な地盤のために沈下している。"},{"sentence":"The road subsided after the heavy rain.","translation":"大雨の後、道路が沈下した。"},{"sentence":"The foundations of the building began to subside.","translation":"建物の基礎が沈下し始めた。"}],"collocations":["ground subsides (地面が沈下する)","building subsides (建物が沈下する)","road subsides (道路が沈下する)","land subsides (土地が沈下する)"],"synonyms":["sink","settle","descend","lower"],"antonyms":["rise","ascend","heave"]}],"etymology":{"value":"ラテン語の「subsidere」（座り込む、沈む）に由来。sub-（下に）+ sedere（座る）から構成される。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/səbˈsaɪd/","syllables":"sub-side"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["subside","subsides"],"past_simple":"subsided","past_participle":"subsided","present_participle":"subsiding"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**subside**」は、主に「静まる」または「沈下する」という意味で使用される動詞です。感情、騒ぎ、嵐、痛みなどが弱まる、鎮まる、または収まる場合に使われます。また、地面や建物が沈む、地盤沈下する場合にも使用されます。前者の意味では、徐々に弱まるニュアンスがあります。後者の意味では、物理的な下降を指します。","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The pain was subsided quickly.","correct":"✓ The pain subsided quickly.","note":"「subside」は自動詞なので、受動態で使う必要はありません。"},{"incorrect":"✗ The building is subduing.","correct":"✓ The building is subsiding.","note":"「subduing」は「subdue」（鎮圧する、抑制する）の現在分詞形で、「subside」（沈下する、静まる）とは意味が異なります。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["subsidence (名詞: 沈下、地盤沈下、鎮静)"],"priority":"★★☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"中頻度 (Moderate frequency)","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"「**subside**」は、何かが徐々に弱まる、または下がることを表す単語です。例えば、嵐が「subside（静まる）」、洪水が「subside（引く）」、地面が「subside（沈下する）」のように使います。感情や騒ぎが静まる場合にも使えます。少しフォーマルな単語なので、日常会話よりもニュース記事や学術的な文章でよく見かけます。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The swelling in her ankle began to **subside** after she applied ice.","translation":"彼女が足首に氷を当てた後、腫れは引き始めた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"静まる (腫れ)"},{"sentence":"The controversy surrounding the new policy gradually **subsided**.","translation":"新しい政策をめぐる論争は徐々に静まった。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"静まる (論争)"},{"sentence":"The land near the river is prone to **subsiding** after heavy rainfall.","translation":"川の近くの土地は大雨の後、地盤沈下しやすい。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"沈下する"},{"sentence":"Once the initial shock **subsided**, she began to think clearly.","translation":"最初のショックが静まると、彼女は冷静に考え始めた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"静まる (ショック)"}]}
